spell.name: Absolute Zero Disruption
entries: You channel the most extreme cold at a creature you can see within range of the spell.
That creature must make a successful Constitution save or have its cold resistances affected for the duration of the spell.
If it has Immunity, it becomes resistant, if it has resistance, the resistance is ignored.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Tartalis Naillo, personagem do jogador Diego que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Acid Lash
entries: A strand of acid comes forth from your hands.
For the duration and as part of casting this spell, you can use your action to make a melee spell attack with a range of 10 ft, dealing {@damage 4d4} acid damage on a hit.
You can also use your action to hold the acid forth in a 10 ft line originating from you until the start of your next turn.
When you do so, a creature that enters the area or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d4} acid damage. If the creature succeeds, it takes half damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} per level of the spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Adhesion
entries: Two objects that you are touching and that are touching each other become magically glued for the duration.
If either of the objects is being worn or carried by a creature, they can roll a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
The two objects can be pulled apart by a Strength check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Agitate Wounds
entries: You can open the wounds of a creature that is missing hit points.

The creature rolls a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, and {@dice 2d8} more at the end of their turns for the duration or until the creature recovers any amount of hit points or spends a use of a Healer's Kit to patch their wounds.
On a success, the creature takes half damage and doesn't suffer the additional effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases {@dice 1d8} for both the initial damage and the extra effect per level of the spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Agra's Ambush

components.m: Roughly ground glass, which must be sprinkled around the target

entries: You create a mental trap that springs whenever your mental faculties are tampered with.

When the target is affected by spells or magic effects that charm, frighten or force a certain behavior out of them caused by a creature, the target can force that creature to roll an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and losing the spell or magic effect on a failure or half the damage and no extra effect on a success.
After it activates, the spell ends regardless of the result of the sainvg throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, it can activate one extra time for each slot level above 2nd instead of immediately ending on the first activation.

spell.name: Aika's Lightning Fury
entries: Com um olhar eletricamente carregado, seus olhos liberam uma sobrecarga de raios serpentinos, que dançam pelo ar e são capazes de realizar curvas imprevisíveis até atingirem seus alvos com uma descarga fulminante.
O raio, formado de uma linha de 90 feet de distância e 5 feet de largura, é capaz de realizar  curvas (5ft) até terminar o seu trajeto em 90 feet de seu ponto de origem.
Cada criatura atingida pela linha deverá fazer um teste de resistência de Destreza. Uma criatura sofre {@dice 4d8} de dano elétrico se falhar na resistência, ou metade desse dano se obtiver sucesso.
Uma criatura só poderá sofrer dano dessa magia uma única vez.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: O dano aumenta em {@dice 1d8} e o alcance do raio aumenta em 10ft  para cada nível acima do 3º.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Aika Kaminari, personagem da jogadora Carol que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Airsphere
entries: A 5 ft diameter sphere of violent winds appears at an unoccupied space within range of your choice.

Any creature that ends its turn within 5 ft of it must succeed a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, be moved 5 ft away from the sphere and, if it's a large or smaller creature, be knocked {@condition prone} on a failure, half damage and none of the extra effects on success. If a large or smaller creature that is flying fails the saving throw, they fall up to 60ft.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 ft. If you ram the sphere against a creature, it must roll the saving throw against the effects again. A creature can only suffer these effects once per round.
The sphere can move in any direction, including up, but disappears if moved more than 60ft away from the caster.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Arachnophobia
entries: The target must roll a Wisdom saving throw when the spell is cast and again at the end of each of its turns or be considered {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell, the source of fear being thousands upon thousands of illusory spiders that cover the target's body. On a success, the spell ends.

A creature that is a construct, undead, or immune to the {@condition frightened} condition succeeds this saving throw automatically. While under the effects of the spell, the creature must use its action to attempt to brush off the spiders.

spell.name: Archivist's Wrath
entries: Você invoca uma aura com dezenas de livros e runas mágicas que voam ao seu redor para auxiliar aliados e combater seus inimigos.
Até a magia terminar, você pode usar uma ação bônus em cada um dos seus turnos para comandar os livros e runas mágicas para atacar uma criatura em qualquer ponto dentro da aura.
Faça um ataque mágico à distância. Ao acertar, o alvo sofre {@dice 5d8} de dano ácido, frio, fogo, elétrico ou trovejante  (escolha o tipo de dano ao conjurar a magia).

Adicionalmente, enquanto estiver na área, cada criatura não hostil na área, (incluindo você) causa {@dice 1d6} de dano extra do mesmo tipo escolhido na conjuração da magia quando acerta com um ataque.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Reevista "Apheek" Eastleaf Sweetfoot, personagem do jogador Tarisu que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Augment Undead

components.m: A piece of cloth taken from a corpse

entries: Three undead creatures of your choice gain +1 to saving throws, attack and damage rolls, and are immune to being turned for the duration of the spell.
To maintain this effect after the duration, you must cast this spell again before the 24 hour period ends. This effect does not stack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: the bonuses increase to +2 when using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, and +3 when using a spell slot of 6th level or higher.

spell.name: Babble
entries: The target must make an Intelligence saving throw or lose all language proficiencies it has for the duration of the spell, making it incapable of speaking coherent sentences or using vocal components for spells.
At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

spell.name: Barrier Reaver
entries: A magical barrier (Such as Wall of Force, Leomund's Tiny Hut, etc) you touch is opened for the duration. A 5 ft opening appears where you touch.
If a creature is in the space of the opening when the spell ends, it takes {@damage 6d6} force damage and is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space of its choice.
If the spell used to create the barrier is of higher level than the spell slot used to cast this spell, it fails.

spell.name: Basilisk Gaze

components.m: A pebble or stone chip and three tears from the caster

entries: For the duration, your eyes glow a ruby red radiance, emitting dim light 5ft in front of you. As an action and as part of casting the spell you can attempt to petrify a creature with your gaze.
A creature that is {@condition blinded} or doesn't have eyes is immune to this effect.

The target must succeed on a constitution saving throw or become {@condition petrified} until the start of your next turn. This petrification becomes undone if the target leaves the area of the spell or if you break eye contact with it.
If the creature is physically broken while {@condition petrified}, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state.
If a creature succeeds this save, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3th.

spell.name: Belsham's Mace
entries: As an action, you create a blunt force that swings against a target. Roll a ranged spell attack.

On a hit, it deals {@damage 3d10} force damage and {@dice 3d10} magical bludgeoning damage, and the target must roll a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its turn and drop all items they are holding.

spell.name: Blacksteel

components.m: A pinch of iron fillings and a scrap of cobweb

entries: As an action, you can turn a weapon into the ideal tool for stealth. Its color becomes black in its entirety and does not make a sound when swinging or hitting against something.
Any blood from attacks with this weapon is absorbed by the weapon.
Divination spells used to locate or attain information about the weapon immediately fail for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Bowgentle's Fleeting Journey
entries: A creature of your choice is teleported up to 40 ft away from its current position to a point you can see of your choice that is not occupied.
The creature can choose to attempt to resist this spell and roll a Dexterity saving throw. If they succeed, nothing happens.
At the end of your next turn, the creature returns to the unoccupied space nearest to its location when the spell was cast.

spell.name: Breathsense
entries: For the duration, you know the location and size of all breathing creatures within 1000 ft of you, provided that they are outdoors.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it won't work on a creature covered by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

A creature doesn't need to be fully encased in one of those materials to be protected from the effect, for example: a human breathing inside a house with closed doors and windows is not detected, even if there are cracks and small spaces within its cover.

spell.name: Brightsong
entries: You create a sphere of protection against movement impairing effects.
For the duration, creatures of your choice within 20 ft of you are under the effects of a Freedom of Movement spell.
Any spell or magical effect that targets the chosen creatures and would aim to restrict their movement or apply a condition that did so fail and are expended.

spell.name: Bubble Breath
entries: You blow forth 3 bubbles, rolling a ranged spell attack for each. They can target multiple targets or the same one.
On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage and is coated in goo, suffering -2 to all saving throws and attack rolls for the duration, or until they use an action to wipe off the goo.
The effect stacks if multiple bubbles target the same creature, but it can also remove all of the goo with a single action.

spell.name: Chant
entries: This spell allows you to bolster your allies and hinder your foes.
Every ally that can hear you within 30 ft of you gains +2 to attack rolls and saving throws, and every enemy subtracts 2 of the same rolls.
While casting this spell, you cannot cast any other spell that demands a vocal component without breaking {@status concentration}.
{@status Concentration} also ends if your capability to use your voice is taken away.

spell.name: Combine
entries: You combine two spells you know and cast them at the same time. The combined level of the spells cannot exceed 7.
The casting time, duration, range, and the number of targets is whichever is most restrictive from the two spells.
If both spells require {@status concentration}, you have disadvantage on checks to maintain it.

spell.name: Comfort
entries: Up to 10 willing creatures of your choice feel no pain, heat, cold, hunger, thirst, {@condition exhaustion}, and need not eat for the duration of the spell.
They are immune to spells and magical effects that would put them to sleep and gain a +1 to wisdom, intelligence, and charisma saving throws.
Not feeling something doesn't mean it isn't happening. The creature's body will suffer any effects as it would normally, regardless of the creature's ability to perceive it.

spell.name: Death Spider
entries: A terrifying twist of the polymorph spell: it turns the appendage no larger than 5 ft of a creature into a spider on a failed Charisma saving throw.
If the appendage is being used to hold something, that thing is dropped.
If the appendage is necessary for the creature's movement, the creature's speed is halved.
If the appendage is used for an attack, such as a tail, or claw attack, that attack is impossible while the spell is held and the spider is alive.
The spider starts with 5 HP and moves at the start of the target's turn. Each round, it consumes part of the limb, dealing {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and gaining 5 HP, growing larger.
The spider has 12 AC and can be killed, but any damage it takes is also taken by the target of the spell. After it dies, it transforms back into the limb it once was.
If the target creature dies, the spider detaches itself from the creature and becomes its own creature with its own initiative, obeying your commands.
It still has an AC of 12, the HP it had before detaching, and it has a bite attack with +5 to hit and {@damage 2d6} damage. It disappears once the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: the spider deals {@damage 1d6} extra damage per round, and with its bite attack per level of spell slot used above 5th.

spell.name: Delay Death

time.condition: in which you see a creature hit 0 hit points

components.m: Wood from a coffin or a chip of stone from a gravestone

entries: As a reaction, you can maintain a creature other than you with 0 hit points from going {@condition unconscious}.
The creature can take its turn normally and, while with 0 hit points, and it suffers the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points.
If the creature fails 3 death saving throws, it stays up until the spell ends, unable to be healed, dying at its end.

spell.name: Despair
entries: A creature of your choice within range must succeed a Charisma saving throw or lapse into a despondent depression, as they realize the hopelessness and folly of their beliefs.

A creature with 5 or less intelligence or with immunity to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeeds. The creature can also roll a saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.
The target is considered {@condition incapacitated}, even though physically capable of acting, everything just seems pointless.

The target doesn't bother to defend itself, so attempts to disarm, bind or move the target automatically succeed, and attacks automatically hit, although whenever one of those things happen the creature may roll another saving throw to end the spell on itself.

spell.name: Detho's Delirium
entries: You touch a creature that is asleep or {@condition unconscious}.

The creature is {@condition charmed}. While {@condition charmed} this way, it begins speaking at random, in all languages it knows, on random, rambling topics. It cannot hear questions or be magically induced to give specific answers.

The creature may utter names, passwords, directions, and secrets, but those are often lost in random ramblings, and a listener would have to roll an intelligence check (DC up to the DM considering the information) to attempt to discern what any given topic is about.
If the creature is awakened at any time, the spell ends.

spell.name: Drenal's Amok Needles
entries: You designate a creature within range and toss a needle in the air. At the start of each of the creature's turns for the duration, it takes 1 piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, this spell uses one more needle per slot level above 1st, dealing 1 more damage. The damage is dealt individually.

spell.name: Elandur's Spacetime Bending
entries: When you cast this spell, choose two points that you can see within the range of the spell.

You create a rift in spacetime, with the chosen points as its edges, each like a magical wall 10ft high and 10 ft wide, facing any direction. The rift connects the two edges as if they were side by side.
Anything (objects, creatures, effects, etc.) that passes through one edge immediately exits on the opposite side of the other edge (and vice-versa), preserving its speed, strength, range, etc.
For the duration of the spell you gain a new action and a new reaction:
{@b Replace Edge (action).} You can reposition one of the edges of the rift to a new point (both the old and new edge need to be within the spell range when you take this action).
{@b Twist Edge (reaction).} You can rotate one of the edges of the rift to face a new direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the range increases by 10 for each slot level above 4th.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Elandur Silverleaf, personagem do jogador Azzarova que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Elevar Cosmus
entries: Seguindo a tradição dos cavaleiros consagrados pelo poder divino dos deuses, você consegue elevar sua capacidade em combate, canalizando e aumentando seu cosmo conforme a batalha progride.

Enquanto estiver sobre o efeito dessa magia, seus ataques com arma causam {@dice 1d6} de dano extra (do tipo da arma) e seu deslocamento aumenta em 5ft. A cada turno em que você mantiver a concentração dessa magia, seu poder se intensifica e os bônus mudam.
Na segunda rodada, o bônus de dano aumenta para {@dice 1d8} e o bônus de movimento aumenta para 10 ft.
Na terceira rodada, o bônus de dano aumenta para {@dice 1d10}.
Na quarta rodada, o bônus de movimento aumenta para 15 ft.
A partir da quinta rodada, o bônus de dano ganha um modificador de +1 cumulativo toda rodada ({@dice 1d10 + 1}, depois {@dice 1d10 + 2}, {@dice 1d10 + 3} ... até {@dice 1d10 + 6}).

Você pode decidir encerrar a magia a qualquer momento, se o fizer, seu próximo ataque no mesmo turno causa xd8 dano adicional, onde x é o número de rodadas que a magia ficou ativa, até um limite de {@dice 3d8}.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Reiki Niko, personagem do jogador Aurorien que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Enchanted Mirrors

m.text: Two adorned mirrors, worth 50g each, which this spell consumes

entries: You enchant two mirrors to reflect spells and use them to replicate them.
As part of casting this spell, choose a cantrip or first level spell you have prepared.
The two mirrors float in front of you, bouncing the power of the spell back and forth. For the duration, you can cast the spell as a bonus action, without using a spell slot.
When this spell ends, the mirrors shatter.

spell.name: Erase
entries: A piece of writing of your choice within range is erased. The writing can be mundane or magical, such as glyphs of warding.
If magical, it is immediately erased if the spell slot used for this spell is of a level higher than the spell used for the writing.
Otherwise, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

spell.name: Fallion's Fabulous Fireball

components.m: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A version of the Fireball spell that was made for artistic purposes, it can be shaped to the caster's will.
When you cast this spell, you can freely draw a line up to 60 ft long. It can curve and even be off the ground.
Anyone caught within the line must roll a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} per slot level after the first.

spell.name: Flame of Justice

m.text: desert bee wax candle worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A zealot's version of Zone of Truth, this spell works as a tool to achieve truth.
If the spell targets a creature that doesn't share a language with the caster, the spell fails, unless another spell such as Tongues or Speak with Animals allows communication when the spell is cast.
The caster can then ask up to 10 questions to the target.
Whenever the target lies, its body bursts into flame, dealing {@damage 1d6} fire damage, plus {@dice 1d6} for each time before this one that this damage was activated.
If the target avoids the question or stays silent, the caster can use their action to trigger the damage once again.
When 10 questions are asked, or when the damage is dealt 10 times, the spell ends.

spell.name: Flashburst
entries: This spell generates an intense flash of light in a 30 ft radius around the caster.
Anyone caught within is considered {@condition blinded} until the start of their turn, and must roll a Constitution saving throw or be considered {@condition blinded} until the end of their turn.
Creatures forewarned before the casting of this spell can automatically succeed by using their reaction to avert their eyes.

spell.name: Fleshshiver
entries: Every turn and as part of casting this spell, you can use an action to force a target to roll a Constitution saving throw as the caster attempts to break/dislodge bones and rearrange organs.
On a failure, it takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and loses 5ft of movement for the duration of the spell. On a success, the creature takes half damage and suffers none of the additional effects.
This movement loss is cumulative for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: the spell deals {@damage 1d8} more damage per level of the spell slot above 5th.

spell.name: Fool's Speech
entries: Up to 8 targets chosen within range gain proficiency in a secret language for the duration.  The language is incomprehensible to others and doesn't remotely sound like another language.
Spells such as Comprehend Languages and Tongues cannot decipher this language.

spell.name: Glassee

components.m: A small piece of glass or crystal

entries: A 5 ft square, no more than 5 ft in depth surface or nonmagical object you touch becomes translucent.
If the object is being worn or carried, the creature can roll a Dexterity saving throw against this spell, ending it on a success.
You can choose to only make it translucent for you or to temporarily turn the material into glass, in which case everyone can see through it, and the material's resilience becomes that of glass.
You can willingly end this spell. When it ends, if the object or surface was broken, it remains so.

Alternatively, if the object is a weapon or piece of armor, the spell renders it only useful for one attack, even if it misses, if a weapon, or one hit taken, if a piece of armor or shield, as it breaks right after.

spell.name: Gloom
entries: Every light within range of this spell is considered dim light for the duration.

spell.name: Great Shout
entries: Your voice booms forth.
Each creature in the 60 ft cone rolls a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} thunder damage and being pushed 30 ft away from you on a failure, half damage, and not pushed on success.
Creatures in the center line of the cone automatically fail the save.

spell.name: Holy Grenade

components.m: um frasco contendo uma mistura de cebola, alho, vinho e sal

entries: Você arremessa um frasco infundido com poder divino até um ponto que possa ver dentro do alcance. Ao atingir o chão ou uma criatura, o frasco explode em uma onda de energia sagrada, cobrindo uma área esférica de 6 metros (20 pés) de raio.
As criaturas na área recuperam pontos de vida igual a {@dice 2d8} + seu modificador de habilidade.

Criaturas mortas-vivas ou ínferas na área não recebem a cura e devem fazer uma salvaguarda de Destreza. Elas sofrem {@dice 2d8} de dano radiante se falharem na salvaguarda, ou metade do dano se forem bem-sucedidas.
Essa magia não tem efeito em constructos.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Quando você conjura essa magia usando um espaço de magia acima do 4º círculo, os dados de dano e de cura aumentam em {@dice 1d8} por cada espaço de magia acima do 4º.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Verdis Dominus Ignis, personagem do jogador Green que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Imbue Undead

components.m: A scroll with a spell's name

entries: You give up the ability to cast a spell and give it to an undead, usually within your command.
Touch the choosen undead creature while casting the spell and a spell you know of a level below the level of the spell slot used for this casting, but not below first level.
You are no longer able to cast this spell until the creature dies, and the undead gains the ability to cast it. The creature can only cast it once and regains the ability to do so on a long rest.
The undead must stay within range throughout the whole casting.

spell.name: Invoke the Nike

components.m: a red glass sphere in the format of an eye

entries: By casting this spell you summon the essence of the one touched by fate, bestowing upon yourself a special boon that can also be consumed to manipulate your own destiny, only once.
Whenever you roll a 1 or a 20 on an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, you can reroll the die. If you do, you must use the new roll.

After making an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, you can choose to either succeed or fail accordingly to your will, regardless of AC, DC, dice result or any modifiers. Then, the spell ends.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Nike Kadawsky, personagem do jogador Thomas que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Jaggar's Strengthened Bastion
entries: Objects in a 100 ft cube of your choice within your vision gain the ability to roll saves against harmful spells, adding your spell modifier plus your proficiency modifier to it, and also gain your spell modifier in AC for the duration.

spell.name: Lightning Cloak

components.m: A bit of fur and a firefly

entries: Crackles of lightning surround your body, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

For the duration, you have resistance to lightning damage, and creatures who step within 5 ft of you must roll a Dexterity saving throw. They take {@damage 3d8} lightning damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn on a failure, half as much damage and no additional effect on a success.
Additionally, for the duration, you can use your action to launch bolts of lightning towards creatures within 60 ft of you.
Roll a ranged spell attack. On a hit, it deals {@damage 3d8} lightning damage on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Lightning Curtain

components.m: A small bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod

entries: You create a wall of lightning on a solid surface within range.

You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is translucent and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. If the creature is wearing armor made of metal, the save is made at disadvantage. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.
The spell also deals {@damage 6d6} lightning damage to each creature that ends its turn inside the wall.
A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Max's Haste
entries: Choose up to three willing creatures that you can see within range.

Until the spell ends, a target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
When the spell ends, a target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

spell.name: Mouse
entries: An object you choose within range smaller than a 5 ft cube is animated.
While under the effects of this spell, the object has an AC of 15 and 1 hit point. It rolls its own initiative with no bonus, and, on its turn, it scurries off away from all creatures.
It can only use the hide action, and if it has no place to hide, the Dodge or Dash action.
It has 30 ft of walking speed.
You can choose to end this spell early.
Damage dealt while this enchantment is in place does not permanently damage the object, just breaks the enchantment.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the object targeted has +1 AC and +5 hit points per level above 1st.

spell.name: Multi-Lock

m.text: Gold dust worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch the wall of a room. It must consist of walls and a ceiling that are connected and intact. You can touch the room you choose from inside or outside.
All doors, windows, and gates leading in or out of the room are affected by an Arcane Lock spell.
When you cast the spell, you can set a password for either all or none of the affected objects.

spell.name: Mycontil's Last Resort
entries: When you cast this spell, deplete all of your spell slots.
Creatures within range must roll a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d12} radiant damage or half on a success.
You then take a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Nystul's Radiant Arch
entries: This spell creates a glimmering rainbow of light.

Roll a ranged spell attack. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d4} damage of each of the following types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Necrotic, Radiant, Poison, Psychic and Thunder, to a total of {@damage 10d4} damage.
It also magically grants the caster the information of every resistance, immunity, and weakness the creature possesses.

spell.name: Rip
entries: You target a creature or an object and attempt to rip it apart.
If the target is a creature, it rolls a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} force damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

On a failure you can also use your action on each of your turns for the duration of the spell to force the target to repeat the saving throw. If it fails, the damage of this spell is increased by {@dice 1d8} until it ends.
Regardless of success or failure on any saving throws after the first one, the target takes the spell's damage when you use this action.

The damage increase is cumulative, meaning that when a target fails each saving throw, the damage dice will begin at {@dice 5d8}, then increase to {@dice 6d8}, then {@dice 7d8} and so on until the spell ends.
The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else or if the target is ever outside the spell's range.
If this spell reduces a creature or object to 0 hit points, it is ripped apart and, if a creature, instantly killed.

spell.name: Sacremon's Acrid Wit
entries: When this spell is cast, a large floating mouth, similar to a magic mouth appears and follows the target. The mouth criticizes, harangues, insults, and berates the target in its native tongue.
As a bonus action and as part of casting this spell, if you haven't used your action to cast Vicious Mockery, you can command the mouth to do it for you, dealing {@dice 4d4} regardless of your level.
If the target dies, you can use your bonus action to move the mouth to a new target within range before casting Vicious Mockery with it.

spell.name: Sandstorm
entries: A 10 ft radius vortex of raging sand appears centered at a point within range. The area is heavily obscured and difficult terrain.
All creatures in the area when the spell is cast or that end their turn in it roll a dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} slashing damage from the sands, taking half on a success.
The sand is coarse and rough, and it gets everywhere.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} per slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Scalding Spout
entries: You attempt to scald a target with a jet of boiling water. Roll a ranged spell attack against a target of your choice.
This spell immediately fails if the target has any level of cover from you, and cannot be cast if there are creatures in between a direct line between you and your target.
On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 5d4} bludgeoning damage from the impact and {@dice 5d4} fire damage from the boiling water.
The fire damage ignores resistances, but not immunity.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, this spell deals extra {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning and {@damage 1d4} fire damage per slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Otto's Abomination
entries: When you cast this spell, choose any number of undead under your control within range to sacrifice.
You invoke an {@creature Abomination|NDD}, consuming the afterlife, bones and flesh of the sacrifices to empower it.
The Abomination is hard to tame, and trying to assert control over it and other undead at the same time will make them hostile to you.
The creature disappears if it dies or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.
Essa magia foi inspirada em Prime Octtavio Tempest Eureka (Pote), personagem do jogador Uzeriel que alcançou o nível 20.

spell.name: Surelife
entries: As a reaction to taking damage which would reduce your hit points to 0, you can cast this spell and stay at 1, even if that damage would kill you outright.

spell.name: Suric's Swift Perusal
entries: You magically enhance yourself to be able to read books at five times the normal reading rate.

spell.name: Temporal Eye

m.text: an adorned veil of fine silk worth at least 200 gp and the eye of a hawk, both which the spell consume. A focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water.

entries: Much like Scrying, you can see and hear a particular creature or object you choose. However, you must also choose an event you know of related to this object or creature's past.
The spell allows you to see this event as if you were there, although creatures and the environment do not interact with you.

You are free to move around in this vision, although no more than 120 ft from the target object or creature, but your body remains still and you are considered {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for the duration.

spell.name: Temporary Resurrection

components.m: A bit of coal and moss

entries: The spirit of a non-undead corpse you touch returns to its body. The creature must have died within the last minute.
Roll a contested Wisdom check against the creature as if it was alive. If you succeed, the creature is revived and restores all its hitpoints.
It is considered Undead but retains all other features, ability scores, and proficiencies it had in life. While it is alive this way, it is considered {@condition charmed}.
While {@condition charmed} this way, the creature acts as it would normally, but it considers you and your allies friends.
If the creature is damaged by you or one of your allies, or if the creature reaches 0 hit points, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the corpse vanishes to dust.

spell.name: Tenser's Deadly Strike

components.m: A full set of tiger claws

entries: For the duration, when you make a weapon attack, the weapon's damage die are treated as if you rolled the maximum damage.

spell.name: There/Not There

m.text: A small bit of cat fur encased in an adorned box worth at least 50 gp

entries: Choose three creatures within range. At the start of each of their turns, they roll a {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, they become {@condition invisible} until the start of their next turn.
On a 20, they also can teleport up to 30 ft away to an empty space they can see right after becoming {@condition invisible}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature per slot above 4th.

spell.name: Thultaun's Thrust
entries: A Large or smaller creature is violently thrust 100 ft in a direction of your choice, slamming and stopping against the first obstacle it meets.

If the creature hits an obstacle, it rolls a Dexterity save, taking {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failure, taking half damage and not falling {@condition prone} on a success. If it hits a creature, both creatures roll a Dexterity saving throw.
The other creature always takes half damage and falls {@condition prone} only if it fails the save. A Huge or larger creature automatically succeeds.
If the creature does not hit an obstacle, it rolls the save against being {@condition prone}, but takes no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can shove the creature 10 ft farther per slot level above 6th, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} per slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Trick
entries: Choose a creature within one size category of you.
That creature must roll a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

On a failure, both you and the creature teleport and switch positions, and a powerful illusion makes you look like the target, and the target look like you, and, for the duration, you can use illusory noises to emulate whatever noises or even the voice of the creature targeted, and, should the creature speak, they do so in your voice.
The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection.
To discern through the illusion, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.
The creature has disadvantage on the check if both you and the creature have spoken since the casting of this spell.

spell.name: Tumble

components.m: A pinch of grease, which the spell consumes

entries: You attempt to shake a Large or smaller creature's balance.
At the end of its turn, it rolls a Dexterity saving throw, falling {@condition prone} on a failure. As an action on following turns, you can use your action to make the target roll this save again.
The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else, if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.

spell.name: Turn Pebble to Boulder
entries: A pebble you toss grows in size and speed.

Anyone in a 10 ft wide, 60 ft line from you must roll a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d8} non-magical bludgeoning damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failure, half as much damage, and no additional effect on a success. Huge or larger creatures automatically succeed the save.
The boulder stops if it hits an obstacle or a Huge or larger creature, not having an effect on anything behind the creature or obstacle if it does.
When the boulder stops, it turns back into a pebble.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 4th.
Additionally, at 6th level, Huge creatures do not automatically succeed the save, and, at 8th level, Gargantuan creatures do not automatically succeed the save.

spell.name: Undead Regeneration
entries: This spell allows the caster to regenerate an undead's resilience. A target undead you touch regains {@dice 5d10} hit points.
Once used, this spell cannot be used on the same undead for the next 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d10} per slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Water Form
entries: You transform someone's body into water.
The target chooses what equipment turns into water and melds into them and what drops on the ground when they transform.
You can still use effects of magical items if they have melded into you.
While in this form you cannot wield weapons, but you gain a Bludgeon attack that deals {@damage 1d6} + strength modifier bludgeoning damage.
The water maintains your general sillouette, but you can drop your own shape to seep through small spaces, so long as you keep yourself as one singular body of water.
While in this shape you have immunity to poison damage, weakness to lightning damage, and resistance to acid, cold, fire, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
You can also move through enemies, and use the Disengage action as a bonus action.
You are considered {@condition invisible} while merged within bodies of water, your attacks are not hampered by being underwater, and you do not need to breathe while in this form.
You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

spell.name: Wind Blade
entries: This spell does not break stealth if cast from hiding. Roll a ranged spell attack against up to five creatures within range.
Wind picks up and tears at the targets, dealing {@dice 6d8} magical slashing damage on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

item.name: Dragon's Pokeball
entries: This magical sphere is made from aged scales from a young dragon and contains an extradimensional pocket plane, magically created to adapt to whichever creature finds its way into it.

You can use an action to send a willing companion (like a mount, summoned creature, or familiar) that's within 10 feet to the pocket plane. This creature cannot be another character, simulacrum, or NPC.
You can also use an action to retrieve the creature from within the extradimensional space, which then appears up to 10 feet away from you, in an unoccupied space.
A character cannot have more than one of this item.

item.name: Dragon Scale Pouch
entries: This small belt pouch is made of a specific type of dragon scales inscribed with magical runes. It has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).
While holding or wearing the pouch you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls accordingly to which type of scales the pouch is made of.
The pouch does not count towards the maximum number of magical items you can use.
The scales also define the rarity of the pouch:
{@item Chromatic Dragon Scale Pouch|NDD}
{@item Metallic Dragon Scale Pouch|NDD}
{@item Gem Dragon Scale Pouch|NDD}

item.name: Draconic Runes
entries: A special mix made from rare leaves and powdered dragon tooth, claws and teeth is heated with dragon fire and carved into an item in the format of ancient runes, empowering it and it's user.
This item must be a non-magical arcane focus, druidic focus, holy symbol, musical instrument or some kind of artisan's tool. After the runes are carved, the item becomes magical.
While holding or wearing this item you gain a bonus to the saving throw DC of spells that can use the item as a spellcasting focus.
Both the bonus and the item's rarity change accordingly to which type of dragon bones were used to create the runes:
{@item Chromatic Draconic Runes|NDD}
{@item Metallic Draconic Runes|NDD}
{@item Gem Draconic Runes|NDD}

item.name: Chromatic Dragon Scale Pouch
entries: This small belt pouch is made of a specific type of dragon scales inscribed with magical runes. It has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).
While holding or wearing the pouch you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls.
The pouch does not count towards the maximum number of magical items you can use.

item.name: Chromatic Draconic Runes
entries: A special mix made from rare leaves and powdered dragon tooth, claws and teeth is heated with dragon fire and carved into an item in the format of ancient runes, empowering it and it's user.
This item must be a non-magical arcane focus, druidic focus, holy symbol, musical instrument or some kind of artisan's tool. After the runes are carved, the item becomes magical.
While holding or wearing this item you gain a +1 bonus to the saving throw DC of spells that can use the item as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Metallic Dragon Scale Pouch
entries: This small belt pouch is made of a specific type of dragon scales inscribed with magical runes. It has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).
While holding or wearing the pouch you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls.
The pouch does not count towards the maximum number of magical items you can use.

item.name: Metallic Draconic Runes
entries: A special mix made from rare leaves and powdered dragon tooth, claws and teeth is heated with dragon fire and carved into an item in the format of ancient runes, empowering it and it's user.
This item must be a non-magical arcane focus, druidic focus, holy symbol, musical instrument or some kind of artisan's tool. After the runes are carved, the item becomes magical.
While holding or wearing this item you gain a +2 bonus to the saving throw DC of spells that can use the item as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Gem Dragon Scale Pouch
entries: This small belt pouch is made of a specific type of dragon scales inscribed with magical runes. It has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).
While holding or wearing the pouch you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls.
The pouch does not count towards the maximum number of magical items you can use.

item.name: Gem Draconic Runes
entries: A special mix made from rare leaves and powdered dragon tooth, claws and teeth is heated with dragon fire and carved into an item in the format of ancient runes, empowering it and it's user.
This item must be a non-magical arcane focus, druidic focus, holy symbol, musical instrument or some kind of artisan's tool. After the runes are carved, the item becomes magical.
While holding or wearing this item you gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DC of spells that can use the item as a spellcasting focus.

ac.special: 10 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: 0. Abomination Build
entries: The numbers of sacrificed undead and spell slot used to create the Abomination enable certain traits and actions for it.
Besides that, the Abomination's size is also determined by a number of creatures sacrificed and the spell slot spent:
{@b Medium:} 20 or less sacrifices, 2nd level slot;
{@b Large:} 21 to 40 sacrifices, 4th level slot;
{@b Huge:} 41 to 70 sacrifices, 6th level slot;
{@b Gargantuan:} 71 or more sacrifices, 8th level slot;

trait.name: 1. Undead Constitution (3rd level, 4 sacrifices)
entries: The Abomination is immune to being {@condition frightened} or {@condition paralyzed}, and it is immune to necrotic damage.

trait.name: 2. Disgusting Form (4th level, 10 sacrifices)
entries: The Abomination gains access to the Disgusting Form action.

trait.name: 3. Grave's Profanity (5th level, 20 sacrifices)
entries: The Abomination attacks deal magical damage.

trait.name: 4. Festering Aura (6th level, 35 sacrifices)
entries: Any creature other than the caster that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Abomination must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's DC or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.
Undead are immune to this aura.

trait.name: 5. Regeneration (7th level, 45 sacrifices)
entries: The Abomination regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the Abomination takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.
The Abomination dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: 6. Abominable Resistance (8th level, 60 sacrifices)
entries: The Abomination is resistant to piercing, slashing and bludgeoning damage, but is vulnerable to radiant damage.

trait.name: 7. Dreadful Absorption (9th level, 80 sacrifices)
entries: Whenever the Abomination is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes a number of attacks equal to half its spell level rounded down.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 1d12 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Disgusting Form (4th level, 10 sacrifices)
entries: Each creature of the caster's choice that is within 120 feet of the abomination and aware of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against the caster's DC or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Abomination's Disgusting Form  for the next 24 hours.
A disgusting abomination created by evil beings with disgusting ideas in mind.
Nothing good can come from this thing.

condition.name: Diseased
entries: A diseased creature is under the influence of a magical disease that spreads and grows very fast, aggresively, unlike common diseases. Thus, the creature always knows that there is something wrong, it feels sick and may know that is diseased, even when it doesn't understand the details or works of it.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature must make an aggravation saving throw against your spell DC. The attribute used on the roll is specified by each magical disease.
If the save fails, the disease worsens and triggers its Aggravation effect, otherwise it slows down and triggers its Relief effect.
Creatures that are immune to mundane diseases have advantage on aggravation saving throws against magical diseases.
Three successful aggravation saving throws (consecutive or not) will cure the creature and make it immune to that disease for 24 hours.

A creature can be affected by multiple diseases at the same time: in that case, aggravation saving throws are rolled separately, and it counts as having multiple (and separate) stacks of this condition.
This condition may be removed by a Greater Restoration, Heal or Power Word: Heal spell.

condition.name: Desecrated
entries: The Desecrated were once living beings that were transformed by the Desecreated Earth. While being transformed, they used the Moon's Blessing energy to empower their souls, keeping sanity and control over their mutated bodies.

entries.name: Creature Type: Undead
entries: You are considered an undead creature for all mechanical purposes of the game, while still keeping your original creature type.
Other undead originating from the Profane Rising do not see you as a threat and are not hostile toward you unless you attack them, making you the perfect infiltration tool.
In contrast, some creatures that would normally not be hostile toward you may become aggressive or suspicious due to your nature.
Your appearance also changes (in a customizable way), reflecting your state of necrosis.

entries.name: Profane Constitution
entries: You have resistance to necrotic and poison damage, but you are vulnerable to radiant damage.
You cannot be healed nor have your life preserved by effects that would not normally work on undead.

entries.name: Putrid Nature
entries: You cannot be poisoned, and you do not need to eat, drink, or breathe.

entries.name: Tireless
entries: You do not need to sleep, and magic cannot put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend that time inactive and motionless, while still remaining conscious.
You have advantage on saving throws against all forms of exhaustion.

entries.name: Undead Resilience
entries: If any source of damage would reduce you to 0 hit points and that damage is neither radiant nor from a critical hit, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken − PB. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead of 0.
The DC of this saving throw increases by 5 each time this feature is triggered, and resets to its base value after a long rest.

entries.name: Touched by the Profane
entries: You have disadvantage on Charisma checks involving non-undead creatures.

entries.name: Walking Corpse
entries: You constantly exude the rotten stench of a corpse.
In an area with other rotting bodies, you have advantage on Stealth checks, while you have disadvantage on the same checks in other areas.

entries.name: Close to Death
entries: You have disadvantage on death saving throws.
Upon dying, your body automatically crumbles into ashes.
Upon choosing to become Desacrated, you automatically gain all characteristics above and your hit points are restored to 50% of their maximum.
This transformation cannot be undone by any means other than death.
{@note This condition was created to be inflicted upon a character when it dies inside a Desecrated Area while wearing his adventurer pin, during The Profane Rising season.}

disease.name: Scarlet Mist's Plague
entries: The Scarlet Mist's Plague was a mysterious disease that struck the continent, spreading rapidly, mutating, and killing thousands of people. It is divided into different stages, each with its own symptoms and mechanical effects.

entries.name: Stage I
entries: {@b Duration. }1d10+4 days.
{@b Symptoms. }Low-grade fever, a mild but persistent cough, and slightly reddened eyes. At night, the victim hears muffled whispers, as if something were breathing beside them.
{@b Effects}

items: Movement speed is reduced by 5 feet.
The creature receives 1 level of exhaustion at dawn.

entries.name: Stage II
entries: {@b Duration. }1d10+4 days.
{@b Symptoms. }High fever, violent coughing, breath tinted red like hot smoke, intense chest pain, and difficulty breathing.
{@b Effects}

items: Movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.
The creature receives 1 level of exhaustion at dawn.
Attack rolls suffer a negative attack modifier equal to half the creature's PB, rounded down.

entries.name: Stage III
entries: {@b Duration. }1d12+ constitution modifier days.
{@b Symptoms. }Pale skin marked by glowing, reddish veins, and labored breathing that releases small sparks and heat.
{@b Effects}

items: Movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.
The creature receives 1 level of exhaustion at dawn.
Attack rolls suffer a negative attack modifier equal to half the creature's PB, rounded down.

At the start of each combat, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or receive 1 level of exhaustion (the DC will float between 15 and 25 accordingly to the intensity or mutation of the disease).

entries.name: Progression
entries: At the end of the stage's duration, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (the DC will float between 15 and 25 accordingly to the intensity or mutation of the disease).
On a success, the creature rolls a new duration time, remaining at the same stage for that time and then repeating the progression test.
On a failure, the creature moves to the next stage. After Stage III, the creature dies.
{@note This disease was created to be inflicted upon a character in several ways during Scarlet Mist's Plague season.}

disease.name: Withering Flash
entries: The creature's muscle mass (or equivalent) begins to atrophy, losing density and aging unnaturally.

The creature has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Additionally, at the start of each of its turns, its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to your cleric level.

items.name: Aggravation (Strength)
items.entry: On the first failure, the effect also applies to Dexterity saving throws. On the second failure, it also applies to Constitution saving throws. Starting with the third failure, the creature gains a cumulative –2 penalty to physical saving throws.

items.name: Relief
items.entry: The creature receives a cumulative +1 modifier on saving throws affected by this disease.

entries: {@note This magical disease is used on pair with the {@condition diseased|NDD} condition.}

disease.name: Minothaurite
entries: The creature loses its sense of balance and spatial awareness, with its senses heavily distorted.

Its movement speeds are reduced by 10 feet, and it has disadvantage on Acrobatics checks, as well as on checks or saving throws made to push a creature or being pushed, grappling a creature or escaping a grapple and against being knocked prone.

items.name: Aggravation (Dexterity)
entries: The creature's movement speeds are reduced by an additional 10 feet, and if any of its movement speeds are reduced to 0, the creature immediately falls prone.
If the creature can't move by not having any movement speed left, it automatically fails Dexterity checks and saving throws.

items.name: Relief
items.entry: The creature regains 5 feet of its movement speed.

entries: {@note This magical disease is used on pair with the {@condition diseased|NDD} condition.}

disease.name: Bitter Torment
entries: The target's body is continuously and painfully assaulted. The creature cannot regain hit points.

The next time it takes damage before the start of its next turn, it must expend one of its Hit Dice and add the result to the damage taken as poison damage. If the creature has no Hit Dice remaining, it instead becomes vulnerable to poison damage.

items.name: Aggravation (Constitution)
items.entry: This effect can repeat one additional time before the start of the creature's next turn. Example: After the first aggravation, the next two instances of damage (instead of only the first) receive the increase.

items.name: Relief
items.entry: The damage taken by the creature is reduced by 1d4 for each time it has benefited from Relief.

entries: A creature that doesn't have a number of hit dice defined uses its CR as the number of dice and the die size is equals to twice its proficiency bonus (PB 2 = d4, PB 3 = d6 and so on).
{@note This magical disease is used on pair with the {@condition diseased|NDD} condition.}

disease.name: Whispering Void
entries: The creature begins to suffer short- and long-term memory lapses, along with impaired cognitive functions.
At the start of each of its turns, the creature rolls 1d20. If the result is 3 or lower, roll 1d4 to determine which of the following effects applies until the start of its next turn:
{@b 1- Long-term Amnesia.} The creature cannot discern alliances and becomes neutral (or hostile, if in combat and wounded) toward all creatures around it.
{@b 2- Short-term Amnesia.} Knowledge acquired in the last 5 minutes is lost (including remembering others' abilities, who attacked whom, or who caused damage).
{@b 3- Aphasia.} The ability to form sentences and communicate is lost, whether by speech or telepathy. Verbal components cannot be used.

{@b 4- Apraxia.} The creature cannot use complex abilities. It can only take the Multiattack (if available) and basic combat actions (attack, grapple, shove, etc.). Passive abilities continue to function normally.
Intelligence checks and saving throws are made with disadvantage.

items.name: Aggravation (Intelligence)
items.entry: The minimum value required on the d20 increases by 2.

items.name: Relief
items.entry: The minimum value required on the d20 decreases by 1.

entries: {@note This magical disease is used on pair with the {@condition diseased|NDD} condition.}

disease.name: Stonebone Syndrome
entries: The creature's body begins to slowly stiffen, causing it to lose the ability to use reactions.
A creature that dies while under this effect is turned to stone.

items.name: Aggravation (Wisdom)
entries: With each failure, the creature is deprived of one of its senses, gaining the following conditions in this exact order: {@condition deafened|PHB}, {@condition blinded|PHB}, {@condition restrained|PHB}, {@condition incapacitated|PHB}, {@condition stunned|PHB}.

The disease continues to worsen even if the creature is immune to one of these conditions; in that case, it does not suffer the effect, but the next aggravation applies the following condition normally.

items.name: Relief
items.entry: The creature regresses one stage of the disease, losing the most recent condition gained from aggravation. If it fails the next check, it regains that same condition instead of progressing to the next one.

entries: {@note This magical disease is used on pair with the {@condition diseased|NDD} condition.}

disease.name: Crawling Delirium
entries: The target's mind is afflicted by vivid and constant hallucinations. It has disadvantage on all ability checks.

At the start of each of its turns, the creature rolls 1d20. If the result is 3 or lower, it must use the dodge action and spend all of its movement to walk in a random direction. Roll 1d8 to determine the direction.

items.name: Aggravation (Charisma)
entries: The minimum value required on the d20 increases by 2.

items.name: Relief
items.entry: The minimum value required on the d20 decreases by 1.

entries: {@note This magical disease is used on pair with the {@condition diseased|NDD} condition.}

entries.name: Ancestral Legacy
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

entries.name: Eerie Token
entries: As a bonus action, you can harmlessly remove a lock of your hair, one of your nails, or one of your teeth. This token is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest. While the token is imbued in this way, you can take these actions:

items.name: Telepathic Message
items.entry: As an action, you can send a telepathic message to the creature holding or carrying the token, as long as you are within 10 miles of it. The message can contain up to twenty-five words.

items.name: Remote Viewing
items.entry: If you are within 10 miles of the token, you can enter a trance as an action. The trance lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or are {@condition incapacitated}. During this trance, you can see and hear from the token as if you were located where it is. While you are using your senses at the token's location, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} in regard to your own surroundings. When the trance ends, the token is harmlessly destroyed.

entries: Once you create a token using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, at which point your missing part regrows.

entries.name: Hex Magic
entries: You can cast the {@spell disguise self} and {@spell hex} spells with this trait. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose the ability when you create your character).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

Onde os desejos falham, a magia ancestral pode conceder o que o coração deseja—pelo menos por um tempo. Hexbloods são indivíduos infundidos com magia arcaica, energia feérica ou feitiçaria misteriosa.

Alguns que fazem pactos com bruxas obtêm seus maiores desejos, mas acabam se transformando. Essas mudanças refletem a influência de uma bruxa: orelhas que se dividem em pontas bifurcadas, pele em tons vibrantes, cabelos longos que voltam a crescer se cortados e uma coroa viva impossível de remover.
Além dessas marcas, os hexbloods manifestam traços semelhantes aos das bruxas, como visão no escuro e uma variedade de habilidades mágicas para enganar os sentidos e evitar perigos.

Embora muitos hexbloods adquiram sua linhagem após um acordo com uma bruxa, outros revelam sua natureza com o tempo—especialmente se tiveram contato com a influência de uma bruxa desde cedo ou antes mesmo do nascimento. Muitos escolhem a vida de aventureiros, buscando entender os mistérios de sua magia, fortalecer sua conexão com sua essência feérica ou fugir de uma bruxa obcecada por eles.
Essa raça foi disponibilizada no servidor pela jogadora Carol, que atingiu o nível 20.

entries.name: Mechanical Nature
entries: You are a robot and cannot be healed or have your life preserved by any effects that would normally not work on a construct made of circuitry (such as items like healing potions or spells like {@spell cure wounds|phb}, {@spell healing word|phb}, {@spell spare the dying|phb}, etc.).

entries.name: Progressive Technology
entries: As you grow in power and experience, you unlock different protocols to assist you in battle:

items.name: Auto-Correction Protocol
items.entry: At 1st level, you learn the {@spell mending|phb} cantrip and regain 1 hit point when this cantrip is cast on you.

items.name: Reactive Shield Protocol
items.entry: At 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell armor of agathys|phb} spell once, upcasted to a level equal to your PB.

items.name: Extermination Protocol
items.entry: At 5th level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once.

entries: Once you cast a leveled spell from any of these protocols, you cannot cast it again until you finish a long rest. You may also spend your spell slots to cast them again.

entries.name: Repair Protocol
entries: You can use your bonus action on your turn to expend your Hit Dice (up to a maximum number equal to half your PB, rounded down), roll them, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier.
This healing cannot be increased in any way.

entries.name: Emergency Protocol
entries: When your hit points are reduced to 0 but you are not killed outright, your Repair Protocol activates automatically (if you have Hit Dice available to expend). Once this ability is triggered, it cannot be triggered again until after a long rest.

entries.name: Construct Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned|PHB} condition.
You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You do not need to sleep, and magic cannot put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentinel's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least eight hours in an inactive, motionless state instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you are not unconscious and can see and hear normally.

entries.name: Integrated Weapons
entries: You were created with a specialized weapon fused into your body. As an action, you can drop whatever you are holding and transform your hand into this weapon, choosing between two options:

items.name: Beam Rifle Mk. IV
items.entry: A ranged weapon with a range of 40/120 feet that deals 1d6 fire damage and uses your dexterity modifier on the attack.

items.name: Thermal Blade
items.entry: A melee weapon that deals 1d6 slashing damage and uses your strength modifier on the attack.

entries: While you have your integrated weapon exposed, you can spend an action to retract it and transform it back into a hand.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

Gundam são grandes máquinas de batalha, forjadas inicialmente para a guerra. Com o tempo, cada uma se especializou em um caminho diferente, sendo os papéis de Defensores e Atacantes os mais comuns. Os Defensores, muitas vezes, são projetados para proteger um local específico, enquanto os Atacantes são máquinas de guerra planejadas para a aniquilação de seus inimigos.

Esses Gundam são construídos a partir de diversos tipos de metais mágicos, que trazem vida a essas imponentes máquinas. Seu papel é definido no momento de sua criação. Entretanto, por algum motivo misterioso, todos os Gundam possuem uma alma — e ninguém sabe ao certo o porquê.
Essa raça foi disponibilizada no servidor pelo jogador Dann, que atingiu o nível 20.

entries.name: Origin
entries: When you choose this race, you must choose another playable race. Your physical appearance and you size is identical to that race, but you do not gain any of its traits.

entries.name: Magical Composition
entries: Your form of life is complexly intertwined with magic; literally sustained by arcana, but somewhat fragile compared to other forms. Because of this, you gain the following traits:

When you enter an area of magical suppression or are affected by a dispel magic effect, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion|phb} and take damage equal to the roll of 1 Hit Die + your Constitution modifier. You can't reduce this damage in any way.
You radiate arcane energy from the schools of Illusion and Conjuration.

entries.name: Essential Skill
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana|phb} skill.

entries.name: Arcane Spark
entries: You were created with an innate magical capacity to protect yourself from the dangers caused by your form:

items.entry: You know the {@spell mending|phb} cantrip.
Upon reaching 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell expeditious retreat|phb} spell.
Upon reaching 5th level, you can cast the {@spell misty step|phb} spell.

entries: Once you cast one of the leveled spells from this trait, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.
You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (chosen when selecting this race).

entries.name: Arcane Repair
entries: When you are targeted by the {@spell mending|phb} spell, you may choose to expend one Hit Die to heal yourself, adding your Constitution modifier to the healing.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, as long as you have Hit Dice available to expend.

In addition, you were designed in such a way that you can be affected by healing and life-preserving spells that normally do not work on constructs (such as {@spell cure wounds|phb}, {@spell healing word|phb}, {@spell spare the dying|phb}, etc.).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.
Replicantes são formas criadas com magia; uma cópia de outra forma de vida que adquiriu independência de seu criador.
Sua origem mais comum vem da magia Simulacrum. Outros, mais inusitados, são Clones que acordaram sem que sua contra parte tenha morrido, ficando sem uma alma por muito tempo.

Existem ainda aqueles que são resultados pouco ortodoxos, como a manipulação de um necromante para reviver um guerreiro antigo... Independente da origem da criação de seu corpo, essas formas artificiais de vida se tornam uma Replicata no momento que sua existência é agraciada pela dádiva que define a vida de uma criatura, uma alma.

Por conta de suas origens ímpares, as Replicatas tem aparência idêntica a raça da sua criatura de origem... Porém, mesmo que formuladas por culturas ou conjuradores diferentes, elas tem uma estrutura mágica inconfundível e podem ter um ou mais sinais de magia pelo corpo: veias saltadas de tom púrpura, runas e glifos pela pele, olhos de coloração incomum, ausência de calor corporal, sinais vitais fracos e até mesmo pequenos traços de outra raça.
Essa raça foi disponibilizada no servidor pelo jogador Tarisu, que atingiu o nível 20.

entries.name: Age
entries: Grungs reach adulthood in just one year, but can live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: Any creature that grapples you or otherwise comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned|phb} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned|phb} creature that is no longer in direct contact with you can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can also apply this poison to any piercing weapon as part of an attack with that weapon. In this case, on a hit, the poison reacts differently: the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 2d4 poison damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump can be up to 25 feet and your high jump can be up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Poison Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition on yourself.

In addition, you can use your reaction once to become immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition until the end of your next turn. You regain this ability when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries: If you don't immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour during a day, you suffer 1 level of {@condition exhaustion|phb} at the end of that day. You can only recover from this {@condition exhaustion|phb} through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Vulnerability to Extreme Heat
entries: Grungs exposed to extreme heat must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of 30 minutes, instead of 1 hour.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Grung.

Os grungs são humanoides agressivos e territoriais, semelhantes a sapos, que vivem em florestas tropicais e seguem uma sociedade rigidamente dividida em castas. Nascem com uma coloração acinzentada esverdeada e adquirem a cor de sua casta ao amadurecer, o que define seu papel na tribo, como guerreiros, trabalhadores, estudiosos ou líderes. Além disso, secretam uma toxina venenosa para outras criaturas, usada tanto como arma quanto para subjugar escravos, que são mantidos fracos e submissos por meio de alimentos levemente envenenados. Como anfíbios, precisam se imergir regularmente na água para evitar o esgotamento.

Cada casta possui funções específicas: os grungs verdes são guerreiros e trabalhadores, os azuis são artesãos, e os roxos administradores. Os vermelhos atuam como estudiosos e usuários de magia, enquanto os laranjas são guerreiros de elite e supervisores. No topo, os grungs dourados ocupam as posições de liderança, com o soberano da tribo sempre sendo um deles. Embora a casta seja geralmente permanente, indivíduos excepcionais podem ascender por meio de rituais, mudando de cor e garantindo um status elevado também para seus descendentes.
Essa raça foi disponibilizada no servidor pelo jogador Matheus, que atingiu o nível 20.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sayajins live on average between 80 and 100 years.

entries.name: Athlete
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|phb} skill.

entries.name: Combat Fists
entries: You can use your fists to make unarmed strikes. Your unarmed strike deals 1d6 + your strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Natural Fighter
entries: When you make an unarmed strike and both your hands are free, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage rolls of that attack.

entries.name: Energy Wave
entries: You gain a new attack option that you can use with the Attack action: a special ranged attack that deals 1d6 + your Dexterity modifier force damage, with a range of 30 feet. You are proficient with this attack.
When you gain the Extra Attack feature, you can use this special attack for any of the attacks you make as part of the Attack action.

entries.name: Super Sayajin
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to transform into a Super Sayajin warrior for 1 minute. Your hair becomes bright yellow and you gain a radiant aura around you.
During this time, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
When you transform, you gain temporary hit points equal to 5 × your proficiency bonus.
Until the transformation ends, once per turn, you can deal extra force damage to a target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
Starting at 5th level, you also gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed while transformed.
Once you use this transformation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

Os Sayajin são uma raça humanoide de guerreiros naturalmente aptos. São originários de um plano em que a gravidade é dezenas de vezes mais intensa do que a do plano Material, o que faz com que eles sejam naturalmente fortes.
O gosto por brigas e guerras, no entanto, parece ser cultural e originário do respeito que os membros tem pela lei do mais forte.
Essa raça foi disponibilizada no servidor pelo jogador Natã, que atingiu o nível 20.

subclassFeature.name: Pestilence Domain
entries: Plague domain clerics are rare and generally feared by the common folk. They are seen as harbingers of disease and rot; famous for their proficiency with blights and infestations, they have deep knowledge of the gods of pestilence and what appeases or enrages them.
Talona in the Forgotten Realms, Morgion in Dragonlance, and Incabulos in Greyhawk are great examples of those deities who empower their followers with some control over their own domain.

Thus, clerics of the pestilence domain are able to create, destroy, and manipulate all manner of poisons and diseases while keeping themselves untouched and immune, employing this power for good or evil.
